text: especially brutal when you're hauling video gear upstairs after a shoot – feels like extra unpaid work lol
record stores are now escape rooms 👾
used book stores are now just hip decor for insta pics
our old dvd rental spot turned into an artisanal cheese shop...talk about plot twist!
editing sessions kinda feel like hitting pause on city craziness.
saw our editing suite get upgraded from ancient tech too - sure it's slick now but kinda miss those quirky old machines whirring away. feels like some essence got lost?
skatepark's gone had no clue they built condos now
miss those chaotic arcade sounds more than endless latte art pics tbh
movie nights at mine have become legendary—or at least i tell myself that—ditch expensive tickets for home screenings... plus who doesn't love homemade popcorn economics? 🍿😂
binge-watching old movies > expensive nights out
rent's no joke so it's mostly homecooked meals and free entertainment these days
switched up going out for movie nights into mini editing projects - get creative & don’t feel bummed missing theater trips tbh
secret rooftop screenings are peak city magic
and it's not just films or jazz - those impromptu poetry slams at local coffee shops? they're like real-life bonus tracks you never knew you needed after a long day editing footage.
new edit suite kinda feels like home now - cozy vibes amidst chaos tbh
funny how home went from parents' house to any place i crash at after editing gigs - pizza boxes included as decor kinda ties it all together.
work hustle kinda reshapes your 'nest', doesn't it?
still planning to edit blockbuster hits one day!
retirement's cool but those edits won't cut themselves!

stories are dope—they're like our own director's cut of life—but can't ignore tech advances basically rewriting what we can do every day. it’s all part of the big plot twist called 'growing up', i guess.
budgets are cool but ever hit all green lights on your way somewhere? real lvl 100 boss move there
budget balancing this month felt epic
DIY's cool n all, but ever tried budget filmmaking? Pure skill.
figured out making ramen without setting off my smoke alarm - low-key home chef level unlocked
owning property feels like winning lotto rn lol
escaping into sims just to 'build' your house hits different when you see those real-life price tags, doesn’t it? total fantasy league now.
Editing on actual film feels super cool compared to digital!
honestly just making rent feels like leveling up sometimes
even good budget won't fix week-old ramen nights because paychecks barely cover rent nowadays
nah man even budget wizards feelin' this pinch
always thought i'd make big bucks & jumpstart indie film projects by now - instead getting hyped whenever i snag editing gigs. lowkey love these small wins more than expected tbh 🎬
dreamt big - editing vids instead but still beats desk job
kinda cool how plans shift - thought i'd have big bucks but honestly? piecing together stories frame by frame has its own magic. serotonin spikes every time i nail an edit!
def thought i'd own more than ramen by now 😅
but hey still aiming for that director's chair 🎬
editing’s kinda cool cuz you craft stories all day, gets your creativity flowing even when rent’s like playing survival mode 😂 always dreamt bigger tho... maybe directing someday? 🎬
editing gigs got their ups n downs but passion > predictability
thrills are cool n all but creating stories through edits? nothing beats that buzz even on tight budgets - always hunting down those unique projects! 🎬
editing gigs are cool but rent’s basically another screenplay drama
feels - dreams & bills don't always match up
spreadsheets are my best friends tbh
find those online editing gigs always help smooth out rough patches renderItemJobsLinkbucks

sure feels like you start out stoked just to have enough dough for pizza nights but soon realize even ramen budgets need padding if you're dreaming bigger – like decent gear or not freaking out over every unexpected bill.
the grind never stops but neither do dream goals amirite
frugal living's like that secret level-up trick nobody talks much about – gets you closer to those big boss battle dreams while keeping your wallet from rage quitting!
budget's definitely more ramen than ribeye right now tbh
yeah feels like i'm chasing an ever-moving target too
def not bound by degrees here - part-time editing gigs are keeping me fed rn while i'm still grinding through film school. reality’s kinda like a choose-your-own-adventure book lol
film school grind pays off here - editing gigs underway
doubt i’d be scorsese useful unless we’re talkin' morale-boosting apocalypse screenings...
so if i'm stuck after like world-end level stuff... not great tbh 😂. but hey, people gonna need entertainment right? plus i'd be ace at documenting whatever new society comes outta that mess!
who bothers with copyrights when there's no internet to stream?
film studies... ghost town creds mean i can scout cool movie set locations? but yeah only hope would be if people needed distraction - then boom, impromptu cinema from abandoned cars or something.
studying film sounded cool but turns out it's mostly odd jobs & grinding edits at midnight just so i can still eat ramen - hoping that gamble pays off big someday!
film school’s cool but editing gigs? total plot twist!
ever notice real-life scenes that scream 'cinematic foreshadowing’?

kinda halfway through that rn - juggling cuts for indie films while hitting books 📚 gets you thinking if all those late edits pay off... but even rough cuts can turn into masterpieces, so i'm sticking around for the final cut!
film studies feel right but your 'what-ifs' hit home too
film school got me cutting reels instead of ribbons at premieres...still grinding though
honestly think passion doesn't always mean smooth sailing after grad...i mean even with films it's more grind less glam yet here we are
back-of-the-envelope in digital age? yikes!
had an edit deadline but software crashed - literally stitched clips together using free trials & weird codecs. felt like hacking nasa just so clients could see some rough cuts!
cuts & frames make reality editable
editing a bunch really messes with your head - you start seeing life cut into scenes & wondering which soundtrack fits best lol science vs art but hey we're all rewriting our narratives sockfd

not sure i buy into sustainability just cuz we use local eats - editing docu footage tells me there’s more shades than just green when you look at those issues. everything's got layers like some kind of narrative onion; peeling back one layer only shows another underneath.
film school's wild like that - projects evolve & suddenly you're cutting horror shorts instead of romcoms lol
totally get where you’re coming from - kinda thought i’d be making blockbuster movies by now... anyways editing small projects can still feel pretty epic cause stories matter man 😂
editing gigs pay bills but movies are where it’s at
film studies right now but edgy indie films > spreadsheets anyday
film editors aren't always introverts; spreadsheets galore for project tracking!
can't just "watch" films anymore - always editing them in my head lol
still fighting for real equality behind-the-scenes tbh
often edit footage where i'm outnumbered but hustle speaks volumes!
film world's similar - seeing more diversity behind scenes too!
still getting tokenized vibes tbh
match-making feels like editing - cut your best trailer
feels like everyone’s editor tailoring profiles tbh
filters skew perception big time – gotta navigate through highlight reels vs reality.
feels like we’re just extras in someone else's romcom.
film's been a huge part of me forever & never really thought about whether it was a 'guy thing' while getting into editing - just went for it because i love telling stories through cuts and frames.

film's an oddball sometimes when it comes down to gender norms. been edging toward that since forever - never felt pushed into something 'cause "that's where dudes go". guys... girls... we're all storytellers at heart anyway.
career-wise? nah, more into breaking story stereotypes than societal ones.
never really felt confined by those stereotypes tbh
storytelling knows no gender—just gotta chase those frames that tell your tale right
found editing gigs just naturally clicked for me
always thought knitting was just grandma territory until i picked up some needles for a prop... turns out its kinda therapeutic? plus scarves for days - who knew!
busted myths helping out at fashion shoots - not just for aspiring models!
ditched mechanics for knitting here - scarves are cozy as heck!
knitting’s meditative too - ultimate chill!
That first power-up must’ve been super satisfying!
always got weird looks playing pretend director instead of football like the other kids - guess i'm still bucking trends working behind the camera instead of some corporate gig
always found edit bays cooler than ball courts - passion over stereotypes tbh
def played more video games than football thanks dad lol
making cuts in film timelines instead of making touchdowns has its charm too 😅 feels like solving puzzles all over again but cooler
managed teams better than any coach could've taught me just saying
age doesn't automatically download life achievements though 🤨
gender roles? more like outdated casting calls imo...industry still stuck tbh
in film school i saw both sides - some dudes into costume design got side-eye while girls were directors killing it behind camera. makes you think 🤔
freedom rocks but life’s chaos shapes views too
still gotta deal w/ curveballs life throws tho

films have been both work n study recently so not sure if it counts as shifting hobbies? though definitely getting wayyy deeper into indie flicks than ever thanks to all the free time flying solo gives you.
totally get that balance between me-time passions & 'us-time' vibes – tricky business indeed! 🎬👀
always ready for another rabbit hole on reddit
spend way too much time falling down youtube editing tutorials—those skills aren't gonna sharpen themselves!
hate to admit but some solo gaming nights def took a hit when dating got serious - seems like movie marathons are our jam now lol
focus right now's mainly career grind mode, may change things down the line when i start scouting for someone who digs film edits as much as me lol
sometimes solo means missing out on cool gigs
def feels like i have more freedom, especially when projects drop at weird hours
def seen both sides firsthand
amenities are cool but they don't replace old neighborhood charm.
got mixed feelings - cool vs overexposed
think backdrops we grew up around end up being low-key set designs in our heads? subtle, but they defs color our stories even when we're going for something totally different.
every frame reflects roots... sometimes subtly though
stories evolve kinda like people do - we start somewhere small but then experience stretches our canvas beyond just hometown vibes.
grew up surrounded by stories - sorta shapes your lens y'know?
those feels hit different when editing late at night
so city lights over starry nights for me - always felt like those big screen dreams were calling out, even though making ends meet is more indie flick than blockbuster atm.
big city hustle inspired me but wallet says otherwise lol
those west coast sunsets hit different after time away
kinda miss that sea breeze feel though
missing those big city lights sometimes too
